column4: Hi, I dont get ip-forward working in Ubuntu. Anyone got a suggestion?  sudo echo "1" > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward  give me permission denied.
you need to quote the qhole command
Also tried " at other places and totally without. sudo "echo 1" > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward for instance, always permission denied.
bash: /proc/net/blah: No such file or directory
oh come on - you know /proc/net/blah is not a real thing
yes, the redirect is not carrying the sudo permissions
I need to bring the sudo permission with the >. How is that done?
Ive found some ip_forwarding stuff in /etc/sysctl.conf, but it will take a reboot?    net.ipv4.ip_forward=1
Thanks, I tried wine, but that was private channel.
